alert.note: Alert for Cooke (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 08 at 8:01PM CST until March 12 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Cooke and Montague. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor-drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gainesville, Bowie, Nocona, Muenster, St. Jo, Lindsay, Lake Muenster, Sunset, Lake Amon G Carter, Hubert H Moss Lake, Valley View, Montague, Prairie Point, Forestburg, Mallard, Bonita, Capps Corner, Rosston, Bulcher and Hood.
